alert.note: Alert for Beaver (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 10:40AM CDT until July 09 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Beaver River at Beaver affecting Beaver County. For the Beaver River...including Beaver...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Beaver River at Beaver. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor overbank flooding of farm and ranch land occurs. No significant damage expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.1 feet this afternoon. It will then rise to 8.4 feet Monday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM CDT.
